com.googlecode.batchfb.impl
Class Batch

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.batchfb.impl.Batch
All Implemented Interfaces:
Batcher, Later<org.codehaus.jackson.JsonNode>
public class Batch
extends java.lang.Object
implements Batcher, Later<org.codehaus.jackson.JsonNode>

Everything that can be done in a single Batch request.

There are three states to a batch:

  • It can be waiting for additional requests to be added
  • It can be fetching asynchronously (no more requests allowed)
  • It can have all the data available

Author:
Jeff Schnitzer

paged

public <T> PagedLater<T> paged(java.lang.String object,
                               java.lang.Class<T> type,
                               Param... params)
Description copied from interface: Batcher

Enqueue a Graph API call to an endpoint that results in paginated data. Any of the Facebook "connections" fit this pattern; the results look like:

{ data:[{...},{...}], paging:{previous:"http://blahblah", next:"http://blahblah"} } The PagedLater returned from this method can be used to navigate forwards and backwards in the pagination. For example, you could have a PagedLater that provides the list of User objects plus additional PagedLater for the next and previous pages.

Specified by:
paged in interface Batcher
Parameters:
object - is the connection object to request, eg "me/friends" or "1234/feed". Doesn't need to start with "/".
type - is the type of the element that will be paged across
params - are optional parameters to pass to the method.

execute

public void execute()
Description copied from interface: Batcher
Immediately start execution of the batch, asynchronously if possible. Normally there is no need to call this method explicitly; execution is triggered automatically when the first Later.get() call is made. If no calls are queued, nothing happens. If batch was already executed, nothing happens.

Specified by:
execute in interface Batcher

get

public org.codehaus.jackson.JsonNode get()
                                  throws FacebookException
The Batch itself is a Later that will return the raw batch result. We hide the actual batching behind this method.

Specified by:
get in interface Later<org.codehaus.jackson.JsonNode>
Throws:
FacebookException - if anything went wrong with the Facebook interaction
